title: Ask an expert: do we borrow or sell to help our kids buy?
text:
We are 57 with two adult children. I want to sell our buy-to-let flat to get them on the property ladder. But my husband wants to remortgage our home, give £100,000 to our eldest, who is closer to buying, and pay it off with our pension lump sums in 10 years' time. He says he can then save enough from his salary to give our youngest his share in three years. Who is right?

MK, Wilmslow

A typical first-time buyer now needs to save for 18 years to build a deposit, up from three in the mid-Nineties, says the Resolution Foundation, a think tank.

House prices may be on the decline - the Land Registry put the average at £226,000 in March, lower than the previous month but virtually flat since last year...
